WorkItem.Description:
Hi!
 
Hit and expertise being, as far as I know, rather important for a Bear druid, I was wondering why they aren't there anymore.
 
I tried the optimizer without them, (in case it was already included in the optimization) and I ended up with those two values being under the cap by a large amount. 
 
I haven't read anything about a change in the bear model concerning that issue, so I post it here
WorkItem.Summary: [Bear] Hit and Expertise Requirements aren't there anymore

Comments.Message:
It was a bug that there was a "Hit Rating" or "Expertise Rating" optimizable stat at all. 

You should be using Avoided Attacks % and/or Avoided Interrupts % (if that's what you care about) for optimizing in that regard.

However, they are incredibly *un*important to a Bear, and you will be gimping yourself terribly if you do so. The only reason to hitcap as a bear is if you must interrupt, and only then as a last possible resort (should have other raiders do interrupts, not a bear). There is utterly no reason to expertise cap currently.
Thanks for the answer! It looks like I've been mislead since WotLK by various web sites...
